document.docAuthor: Floriano, Carla Fernanda Burguez & Rodrigues, Higor D. D.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Oiovelia (Heteroptera: Gerromorpha: Veliidae) from Mesoamerica, with an identification key to the genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Oiovelia (Heteroptera: Gerromorpha: Veliidae) from Mesoamerica, with an identification key to the genus

heading.emphasis:
Key to the species of
Oiovelia

materialsCitation.keyLead:
1. Head, legs and pronotum creamy yellow in apterous form (
Fig.
4
I); pronotum brown on anterior lobe in some macropterous specimens ( Fig. 3 A, C); male proctiger with a small conical process on half of dorsal surface; paramere wide at base, tapering distally, with hook-like apex ( Fig. 2 E)...................................
Oiovelia spumicola Spangler
( Venezuela )

paragraph.keyLead: - Head, legs and pronotum orange, reddish brown, orange brown or blackish in apterous and macropterous forms ( Figs. 4 A–H); male proctiger without small conical process on dorsal surface (as in figs. 2D, F); apex of paramere rounded or truncate, not hook-like ( Figs. 2 D, F, G–N)........................................................................... 2
2. Posterior lobe of pronotum with an evident whitish pruinose area, generally V-shaped ( Figs. 4 A, C, G, H).............. 3
- Pruinose area on posterior lobe of pronotum, if present, with irregular form and not so evident ( Figs. 1 , 4 B, D–F)........ 6

3. Forewing with uniform and faint whitish pruinosity covering the entire surface, at most absent on a small portion below basal macula ( Fig. 4 H); paramere narrowed medially and distinctly widening to apex ( Fig. 2 M).........................................................................................
Oiovelia rivicola Spangler
(Venezuela and Brazil)

- Forewing with whitish pruinose areas well delimited between cells ( Figs. 4 A, C, G); paramere not distinctly widened at apex ( Figs. 2 H, J, L)...................................................................................... 4

4. Pronotum uniformly colored, varying from orange to reddish brown ( Fig. 4 G); mesocoxae brown to dark brown ( Fig. 4 L); paramere tapering to apex ( Fig. 2 L).................................
Oiovelia pydanieli Rodrigues & Melo
(Brazil)

- Pronotum varying from orange brown to reddish brown, with anterior lobe dark brown to black ( Figs. 4 A, C); mesocoxae yellow to yellowish brown ( Figs. 4 J–K); if paramere tapering to apex, then proctiger with a slight depression medially on dorsal surface............................................................................................. 5

5. Major part of propleura and all mesopleura dark brown to black ( Fig. 4 J); proctiger of male with a slight depression on dorsal surface of posterior half; paramere slightly tapering to apex ( Fig. 2 H)........
Oiovelia chenae Rodrigues & Melo
(Brazil)

- Pro- and mesopleura with dorsal half orange brown and ventral half dark brown ( Fig. 4 K); proctiger of male without depression on posterior half; paramere slightly narrowed medially, with apex slightly more expanded ( Fig. 2 J)................................................................................
Oiovelia hamadae Rodrigues & Melo
( Brazil )
6. Proctiger of male with a pair (1+1) of small spines medially on dorsal surface (as in fig. 2F)......................... 7
- Proctiger of male without spines on dorsal surface (as in fig. 2D).............................................. 8

7. Pronotum reddish orange; legs yellowish to light brown; pruinosity on forewing not well-defined ( Fig. 4 D); paramere with a slight ventral expansion ( Fig. 2 G).........................
Oiovelia brasiliensis Moreira, Nessimian & Rúdio
(Brazil)

- Pronotum and legs blackish; pruinosity on forewing well-defined between cells ( Fig. 4 E); paramere not expanded on ventral surface ( Figs. 2 F, K)..........................................
Oiovelia machadoi Rodrigues & Moreira
(Brazil)

8. Pronotum dark brown to black ( Fig. 4 F); paramere with a slight expansion on ventral surface of posterior half ( Fig. 2 N).....................................................................
Oiovelia viannai Rodrigues & Melo
( Brazil )
- Pronotum distinctly orange to reddish brown ( Figs. 1 , 4 B); paramere without expansion on ventral surface ( Figs. 2 D, I)... 9

9. Head dark brown to black, with posterior region and inner margin of eyes dark orange; pronotum with lateral borders of posterior lobe darker; forewing with faint pruinosity between cells ( Fig. 4 B)........................................................
Oiovelia cunucunumana Drake & Maldonado-Capriles
(Venezuela, Brazil, Peru, Paraguay, and Argentina)

- Head and pronotum distinctly orange; forewing with distinct pruinosity between cells ( Figs. 1 A, E)................................................................................
Oiovelia johnpolhemi
sp. nov.
(Mexico and Belize)
